In the introduction of the novel, the narrator rescues placid lines of liner related to his son Santiago Nasar. In this introduction, the use of the expression augurio ACIAGO refers to the
A) Mystical relationship that is established between Plácida and his son Santiago.
B) Tragic destination of Santiago, which Placida was unable to predict in dreams.
C) mismatch between Santiago's happiness in dreams and its bad luck in reality.
D) Placid belief in the importance of the interpretation of dreams to change the future.
E) recurring presence of dark elements that are revealed in Santiago's dreams.
